alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 8:51PM CDT until May 25 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. For the Headwater Forecasts...including Everman, Arlington, Marys Creek, Cleburne, Cleburne, White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave, Garland, Grand Prairie Alert 10, Grand Prairie, Gainesville, Haltom City, Kaufman, Mansfield, Sachse...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 77.8 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 87.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage after midnight tonight. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
